channel.title: [Project iServer]
channel.description:
[size=18pt][b]PROJECT iSERVER [/b][/size]
[b]Project iServer Development Team:[/b]
[b]FatWallet [/b][b][Primary Programmer, Technical Support, Common Knowledge][/b] [b]Bmaw [/b] [b][Secondary Programmer, Ipod Support, Common Knowledge][/b]
I have recently come from a topic in Server Help that sparked a theoretical, logical, and realistic idea in my head: Running an RSPS via mobile device, in this case, an iTouch. On a jailbroken iTouch, there is a command prompt for it, and you can load files onto it (jailbroken version). I think it is possible. You can flame all you want, and I'm guessing that 90% of you guys will :( But this could be the future of Java Technology!
If you are interested in participating in this project, PM me some info (experience, common knowledge, if you have iTouch access, if you have iPhone SDK access, and as well as email to make it simpler, unless you do not want to reveal that information and just want to receive PMs).
If this sets sail, I would request that this be stickied. And yes, all of our development will most likely be contained in this post :) Hope you guys have fun supporting/flaming/joining/not caring/or whatever it is you'll have fun doing that is related to this post? :D
-FatWallet & The iServer Team

item.title: [Project iServer]
item.dc:creator: @fatwallet fatwallet
item.description:
@fatwallet wrote:

Yes, but our current version is 2.2.1, I didnt say we werent going to test it out on there

Read full topic

item.title: [Project iServer]
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

Newty:

Do you realize that the fucking command prompt has nothing to do with Java? Also, I don’t even believe a jail broken ipod will support Java.

Saurik has helpfully provided a download in cydia called iPhone/Java that you can install on an iTouch and iPhone to get java
Also: why the hell are you using 2.2.1? use 3.0 dont be morons, 3.0 is a much better platform to build this upon especially with 3.1 in beta already

Read full topic

Read full topic

There is software inside of installer that allows for you to install Java VM, its all in my tutorial i posted. Still waiting for approval lol

item.title: [Project iServer]
item.dc:creator: @fatwallet fatwallet
item.description:
@fatwallet wrote:

We are currently testing on firmware version 2.2.1. We are looking for those that would be willing to contribute either: A. Their knowledge, B. their jailbroken itouch (for you to test our code on), C. people with theories for how we could improv our system/code.

Thank you for all those that have joined and started helping! I don’t know if this is advertising but, you can contact me on my msn at: fatwalletscripts@live.com

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @fatwallet fatwallet
item.description:
@fatwallet wrote:

Really? So you’ve tried the new version (2.2.1-3.0)??? Wow, thats pretty fast… You have to PM screen shots man, I’ve gotta revise my entire tutorial that has been mathematically and theoretically proven…tsk tsk shame on me

Read full topic

item.title: [Project iServer]
item.dc:creator: @justin95123 justin95123
item.description:
@justin95123 wrote:

ok im just going to tell you right now it isnt gonna work the best you will get is 1 person max on it with an ipod and for the guy who needs terminal you just go in cydia and type Terminal and then get it… i tried running a server on my ipod and it didn’t work all it barely let me do anything logged on, lagged. CRASH.

Read full topic

[size=18pt]PROJECT iSERVER

Project iServer Development Team:

Bmaw [Secondary Programmer, Ipod Support, Common Knowledge]

I have recently come from a topic in Server Help that sparked a theoretical, logical, and realistic idea in my head: Running an RSPS via mobile device, in this case, an iTouch. On a jailbroken iTouch, there is a command prompt for it, and you can load files onto it (jailbroken version). I think it is possible. You can flame all you want, and I’m guessing that 90% of you guys will But this could be the future of Java Technology!

If you are interested in participating in this project, PM me some info (experience, common knowledge, if you have iTouch access, if you have iPhone SDK access, and as well as email to make it simpler, unless you do not want to reveal that information and just want to receive PMs).
